# TelephonyMessagingSession

**Class**

An object that coordinates interaction with the TelephonyMessagingKit framework.

## Declaration

```swift
final class TelephonyMessagingSession
```

## Overview

Use the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/TelephonyMessagingSession/shared] instance provided by this class to access SMS, MMS, and RCS messaging services. You can inspect available services with the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/TelephonyMessagingSession/cellularServices] property. As service availability changes, the framework publishes changes through the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/TelephonyMessagingSession/cellularServiceStateUpdates] asynchronous sequence.

## Obtaining the shared instance

- **shared**: The shared session instance.

## Determining service availability

- **cellularServices**: An array of cellular services available on the system.
- **cellularServiceStateUpdates**: An asynchronous sequence of cellular service state updates produced by this session.
- **CellularServiceState**: A structure that contains information about a cellular service.

## Using Short Message Service (SMS)

- **smsService**: The Short Message Service (SMS) service associated with this session.
- **SMSService**: A class that provides an interface for performing SMS operations.

## Using Multimedia Messaging Service (MMS)

- **mmsService**: MMS service associated with this session.
- **MMSService**: A class that provides an interface for performing MMS operations.

## Using Rich Communication Services (RCS)

- **rcsService**: RCS service associated with this session.
- **RCSService**: A class that provides an interface for performing RCS operations.

## Accessing session properties

- **id**: Identifier for this session.

## Handling errors

- **TelephonyMessagingSession.Error**: An enumeration of errors that can result from operations on a messaging session.

## Instance Properties

- **isConfiguredForCarrierMessaging**: A Boolean value that indicates whether this app is configured to perform carrier messaging operations.

## Essentials

- **Creating a carrier messaging app**: Use TelephonyMessagingKit to send and receive SMS, MMS, and RCS messages.
- **Default Carrier Messaging App**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the app can use the TelephonyMessagingKit framework to serve as the default carrier messaging app.

## Conforms To

- Identifiable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
